dialog: Sync and corrections by explosiveskull www.addic7ed.com This is it.
This fine trail, we're gonna be the first ever to complete it.
There's no way to ride that.
Come on, Jeff. This is exactly what our sponsors want.
Anyway, we gotta earn these bikes we're sittin' on, and it beats workin' for a livin'.
Yeah, well... While I'm workin' for a livin', you'll be suckin' meals through a straw for the rest of your life.
âª  âª Utah to Heli: We're doin' this.

âª Don't lie baby I know what you're thinking âª Can't hide 'cause I got that intuition âª I see you looking at me âª I know you wanna break free âª It's just a matter of time before we hit the ground âª I think that you would agree âª It's written on the marquee âª It's just a matter of time before you lose control âª Let it go âª It's all right âª Baby, put the gun away âª Oh! Here we go âª Take a right âª Baby, don't you runaway âª Baby, don't you runaway âª Big eyes Come on, tell me what you wanna see âª Ol' dry little lady's got a spell on me âª I see you looking at me âª I know you wanna break free âª It's just a matter of time before we hit the ground âª I think that you would agree âª It's written on the marquee âª It's just a matter of time before you lose control âª Let it go âª It's all right âª Baby, put the gun away âª Oh! Here we go âª Take a right âª Baby, don't you runaway âª Baby, don't you runaway âª Whoohoo!
HALL: This is a new world, son.
When you join the FBI, you join the front line in the war between order and chaos.
So the question is, are you ready for that fight, Utah?
Utah's a nickname my classmates got off YouTube.
That world that you came out of...
Why leave all that  for all this structure?
Maybe I could use some structure, sir.
And maybe there's a part of you doesn't want anything to do with it.
I know why you left that world.
I know what happened in that world to that kid.
How bad do you really want this?
Bad enough to have gotten my high school equivalency at 23, sir.
Bad enough to have gone to college and law school five years after my peers had graduated.
The Bureau reviewed all my credentials before they admitted me into this program.
I'm not sure why you're secondguessing them.
Because it's my job, son, to only let the most qualified get past me.
Because I'm not convinced that you are an FBI agent in the making.
HALL: This is what chaos looks like.
And make no mistake, these perps were very, very smart.
Had a sense of humor, too.
And Mahana Carbon is a majority Americanowned company, so we, the FBI, are interested.
so the entire month's yield from the company's mines was on hand.

Their mistake was believing that nobody could ever rob and successfully make a getaway from a sorting facility And their security failed to foresee that there might exist a set of perps with an unusual skill set.
They saw potential police intervention on the ground, and they improvised.
They got away with 100 million  in uncut diamonds...
...and then gave it all away to the poorest of the poor in the slums of Mumbai.
Who in the world would do that?
These guys are out there in real time.
What kind of people are we dealing with here?
U.S. plane carrying money got hijacked over San Luis Potosi in Mexico.
Perps jumped out over the jungle and disappeared without a trace.
We have two crimes on two different continents.
Diamondsorting facility in Mumbai, and today's cargo plane over Mexico.
But there's a third crime on a third continent.
Remember about a month ago there was an international logging complex that was burned to the ground on the banks of the Congo River...
...which is where the world's most dangerous rapids are.
Now I think the people that started that fire also became the first ever to navigate and survive the Inga Rapids.
You're saying this is connected to the other two?
I think they're all connected, sir.
Two days before the Mumbai heist, only 1,000 miles away, these three were photographed basejumping from the peak of Everest.
Then what are they really up to here?
I don't know why they're committing the crimes, sir.
But I have an idea what they're chasing.
I think they're attempting something called The Ozaki Eight.
He was an ecowarrior, one of the first recognized Extreme PolyAthletes.
Now he challenged the Extreme Sports world to a series of eight ordeals that he said honored the forces of nature.
Anyone who could find the perfect line existing through each one of these ordeals he believed would achieve nirvana.
So this is not about money?
An extreme athlete could potentially train their entire life just to attempt one of these ordeals.
To complete all eight would be to complete the impossible.
Ozaki himself died attempting his third ordeal.
These guys have already completed the first three.
It's called "Life of Water." The National Weather Service is tracking a lowpressure system in the Atlantic.
A massive storm about to hit off the coast of western France.
And when it clears, it's gonna cause a giant swell.
Sir... If I'm right, that's where they'll be.
UTAH: Before finding my way to the FBI, I was what's called an extreme sports polyathlete.
Snowboarding, motocross, any downhill mountain sport, really.
I'm supposed to be on a plane to Mexico in half an hour.
Why am I listening to this?
I believe the people behind the robberies in Mexico as well as the one in Mumbai are extreme athletes.
FBI DEPT. DIRECTOR 1: Isn't that obvious?
I don't think you ride a motorcycle off a building or skydive out of a cargo plane if you aren't.
That last pair cratered somewhere in the jungle.
I don't think they went into the jungle at all.
I think they went through it.
This is the largest natural cave shaft on Earth.
The Empire State Building could literally fit inside it.
And it just happens to be located adjacent to San Luis Potosi.
They surgically identified the perfect line that would intersect them with the jungle exactly where they wanted.
In doing so, they became the first and only to make a skyearth transition into the Cave of Swallows.
FBI DEPT. DIRECTOR 2: But what is the motive for the crimes?
FBI DEPT. DIRECTOR 2: And what does this have to do with guys driving motorcycles out of diamondsorting facilities?
Or raining U.S. currency down over central Mexico?
Well, sir, that's what we need to find out.
Those people in there, they didn't buy your theory.
You're on your way to France.
You'll be met there by Agent Pappas out of the U.K. office.
Now, he's an acquired taste, but you can trust him.
I want you to do exactly as he says, you understand?
Your job, identify these individuals, find out what the connection is between the crimes and the ordeals.
Don't let me down, 'cause my ass is on the line in this.
I don't plan on it, sir.
Surfing? In the middle of the ocean?
Yeah, the storm causes a swell.
It travels thousands of miles through deep water, then suddenly reaches an underwater mountain, and it...
Load your shit. It's time to roll.
So by your, for lack of a better word, "hypothesis," if these guys exist, they'd be out here?
Freak spring swell like this, there's no way they'd miss it.
No one knows when the next one's gonna hit.
It could be Cortes Bank in a year, or maybe five, maybe ten.
It's a needle in a haystack after this.
âª Down in the waves âª She screams again âª Roar at the door âª My mind can't take much more âª I could never drown in âª They wanna get my...

âª They wanna get my âª Gold on the ceiling âª I ain't blind âª Just a matter of time âª Before you steal it âª It's all right âª Ain't no guard in my house âª Clouds covered love's âª Barbwired snare âª Strung up, strung out âª I just can't go without Pick up, pick up!
âª I could never drown in âª They wanna get my...
âª Gold on the ceiling âª I ain't blind âª Just a matter of time âª Before you steal it âª It's all right Ain't no guard in my house âª You ever surf anything like this?
Yeah, but you ever surfed anything like this?
Here comes the set of the day!
MAN 1: Look! There's two guys going for the same wave!
JET SKI DRIVER: What the hell, man?
MAN 2: Back, man! It's not your wave!
MAN 1: That guy, he's snaking the wave!
MAN 3: You're gonna get somebody killed, man!
âª  âª   BODHI: So the old train station in Paris, tomorrow night.
You gonna jump in this time?
GROMMET: I'm still hurting from the last one.
You're the guy I snaked, right?
And the one who plucked you off the ocean floor.
I guess you never surfed anything that big before, right?
You didn't make the choice for me. I did.
Easy, Roach. Don't you know who our guest is?
What's a motocross rider doing on a wave like that?
You almost got your own ass killed today, brother.
BODHI: Sort of the point, isn't it?
UTAH: Hey, man, is this your boat?
The only pot I have, you can't even piss in.
To be the first to achieve the impossible.
Hey, how come I don't know you?
Big wave rider like you? I watch YouTube.
A tree falls in the forest, no one puts it on YouTube, did it ever really happen?
You're asking a lot of questions for someone you don't know.
You and I got something to do. Okay?
You're on your own. Enjoy the party.
AL FARIQ: Everyone have a good time!
Worst party ever? And you're never gonna get invited again.
I saw you on that wave today. It was epic.
I got a real taste of that today.
Yeah, I saw you eat shit.
Nature will always find a way to make you feel small.
I owe Bodhi for pullin' me out.

âª  âª âª I don't care too much for Valentines âª I just need your skin next to mine âª I'm feeling this devotion âª Touching your emotion âª I can see the love run right out of you âª Moments like these are golden âª Never felt so open âª Even if I'm dreaming, I'm dreaming with you âª So breath my air âª And kiss me there âª 'Cause I'm a little cold but I'll warm up with you âª     What does "Samsara" mean?
Can a wanderer have a path?
But it's only when you stop looking for one that you find it.
What are you doing here, Utah?
Some said maybe that was why you were so good.
But what I saw on that wave yesterday, that was different.
Maybe I'm chasing something. Like you are.
What do you think I'm chasing?
But the real question is, what are you after?
That was some crazy, crazy shit.
There's gotta be something there, Pappas.
All I saw was the bottom of my glass.
And a great piece of ass. You?
I just know there's gotta be a lotta guys on that boat who are chasing The Eight.
You got evidence that connects them to our investigation?
I'm takin' you to the airport.
No, I heard some talk on the boat last night about something going down in Paris tonight.
I gotta go check that out.
PAPPAS: I like you, kid, but if you wanna stay on the case, you gotta give me some evidence.
âª  âª  Excuse me. Train station?
It wouldn't be the first time he did something stupid.
I told him to meet us here.
He said he was after something.
No better place to find it.
I just came to catch the scene, man.
I think I know what I'm after.
I'm headed out tonight to find us a mountain, and hopefully arrive at the line.
How long you think it'll take?
There are a few things in life I don't compromise on.
No, I don't get the impression you compromise on much ever.
But the world's a pretty messedup place, and I still gotta live in it.
So you live off the grid?
We change the grid. We give back.
The second that kid got killed on your line, you quit life.
You turned away because of something someone else did.
Fine. That's not for me to judge.
But you let someone else determine the direction your life took.
So you got all your shit figured out, and screw everyone else for trying, huh?
He'll probably be on a plane in the morning.
GROMMET: I guess Bodhi sees something in you.
We leave for the Alps first light.
Depends how fast you are, man.
We still have a long way to go, my friend.
Half a mile of pure primordial rock.
Maybe I should have asked you this before, but you've done this, right?
Except it was out of a plane.
Proximity flight's a whole different monster.
You need to read the flow.
Where fear becomes master, and you're its slave.
A man who pushes his boundaries ultimately finds them.
So basically you're sayin' I'm gonna die.
You wanna keep going, or are you turning around?
You heard the man. Pass the rock.
Should have checked your bag, man.
Six seconds to fly or die.
So we're gonna jump off a mountain and reach nirvana?
But it's not about risking our lives for personal gain.
It is about becoming part of something that is much greater than ourselves.
The Eight honors the essential forces of the Earth.
And Ozaki wanted to complete The Eight to bring the world's attention back to the beauty of this planet.
The fact that it is dying.
We have to give more than we take if we want to stop the destruction of the very place that gives us life.
We're not here to reach enlightenment, to find nirvana.
We're here to try to save this place by becoming one with it.
And to do that, you need to be able to let go of your sense of self.
So go whichever way your heart tells you, Utah.
And if you are on the same path as we are, I may see you at dawn.
Are you ready to let go?
Yeah!    GROMMET: That's how you do it.
UTAH: My mom was a Ute Indian.
That's why they call me Utah.
Means "mountain people." Maybe that's why I was so good on the slopes.
Jeff was like a brother to me. More than a friend.
And he died because of me.
What happened to your friend was tragic.
But it was his choice, not yours.
We can only be responsible for our own path, brother.
BODHI: "Life of Ice." The Sixth Ordeal.
Chowder found the mountain in Italy, but not the line.
You gotta find a line, you gotta do it fast.
Weather's rolling in. You don't wanna get caught up here when it does.
What about that one over there?
I got you. I'll be with the chopper.
That's it. We're done. We're cliffed out.
Grommet? Send the chopper. It's over.
We're never gonna finish what we started if we die on this mountain.
He's up there! We gotta find him!
He's dead! You can't help it! It's not about you!
Are you crazy? That was my line!
The second he committed to it, it became his line!
âª  âª ROACH: Here's to Chowder, guys!
I've been on Mars, man. I've been on Mars.
Man, check out what my boys were doing in Mumbai.
MAN: In Mumbai? The three parachutes?
I know, I know. I gotta go...
I'll be back in one minute.
I'll be back, just wait. One minute!
Hey, it's my pleasure to have you here.
You are always welcome chez Al Fariq.
I want you on my team, man!
âª  âª Daredevil dreams come true.
I can make you a hero, or I can watch you die trying.
He's got more money than most small nations.
Lifted up his leg and pissed out this atrocity all over the mountains.
You know, he doesn't own these mountains, just like he doesn't own us.
Man, I see a lot of taking on the way to enlightenment.
If any of this party is what Ozaki had in mind for the path to enlightenment.
He only cared about the purity of The Eight and giving back whatever he took from the Earth on the way to getting there.
And what did he give back?
Sometimes it was as simple as planting a tree.
Other times it was something much larger.
Like when my parents died in an avalanche when I was nine, he gave me a home.
I know that he died questing his third ordeal.
He could have finished the entire eight.
But instead he got himself killed giving back for that ordeal.
He positioned his small boat in the north Atlantic between a Norwegian whaling ship and a pod of humpback whales.
The whaling ship never even slowed.
The only survivor was a young guy who was on the boat with him.
Well, why didn't this young guy say something?
Why didn't he tell the world?
It wouldn't have made a difference anyway.
As much as I worshipped Ozaki, that was his Achilles' heel.
He truly believed that he could change the world with an idea.
Not as powerful as a whaling ship.
If not ideas, then what else is there?
That young guy on the boat.
Bodhi is going to complete what Ozaki set out to do.
He's going to take a different path to do it.
Came as fast as I could.
I put a 24hour surveillance on Al Fariq's hideaway.
I know exactly what you were doing.
They're just kids partying away their lives on Al Fariq's dime.
The difference between them and you is you're doing it on the FBI's.
Where does that leave you, huh?
Hangin' out on this dock while I'm onto something?
Now I'm sorry if this particular locale lacks the glamour you're accustomed to because there's no drugs or naked girls shakin' their arses.
But that's why we stayed down 'ere all night.
To prove that wasn't an American mine that blew that piece of shit up!
For your information, this is how the real FBI works.
It's dirty, it's pedestrian, and generally downright boring!
I can figure this out, Pappas!
ROACH: You've been gone a day.
Where the fuck have you been?
BODHI: Ready to start talkin' about giving back?
And then we give her an offering.
BODHI: That mine down there has been ripping gold out of her guts for over 20 years.
We're gonna get some of it back for her.
Ashes to ashes, dust to dust, my man.
I get it, okay? People are screwing up the world.
And you wanna do something about it, then you gotta find another way!
The world is burning! Look around!
Do you have a better idea?
There's about a hundred ways this could go really wrong, man.
You're gonna cross a line you can't come back from.
ROACH: Leave the truck! Run! Run!
Get out! Get out! Get out of there!
Help me! Gimme a hand! Help me!
I can't let you do it, brother!
That's it. We gotta get outta here! Let's go!
UTAH: It was you the whole time!
BODHI: If you really wanted to know, all you had to do was ask.
When you showed up in Paris, we knew you were a cop.
Then why'd you let me in?
Because I thought I could save you.
That's when I lost control of the motorcycle and crashed into the river.
By the time I got back to the surface and the riverbank, he was gone.
Your orders were to investigate and report.
So now I got another situation.
$100 million in gold ore lost from Grauman Minerals, which as you know, is another multinational with American ties.
And I got the Director on my ass sending me here from D.C. to end this.
Why did you not follow your instructions, son?
I'd earned their trust, sir, and I wanted to be sure they were the suspects.
So your m.o. is to help them commit another crime?
No! Not at all. I wanted to stop them.
Bodhi doesn't see these as crimes.
He thinks of them as offerings.
Offerings? What the hell does that mean?
What the hell does that even mean?
These guys are trying to complete the Ozaki Eight.
They see that as a gift given to them from the Earth.
To balance out that gift, they want to give back something taken from the Earth.
This case, it was gold ore that was ripped out of the ground.
Now you've been undercover, what, two weeks?
You know how easy it is to lose perspective, son?
What happened here, you got too close to these individuals.
You did exactly what I told you not to do!
I wanna catch these guys, sir. Just like you.
They just don't see themselves that way.
They've taken Ozaki's ideas to the extreme.
They think they're crusaders with a worthy cause.
They're more than willing to die for it.
Every criminal has some bullshit justification for what they do.
And just like every other identified criminal, their profiles are here at Interpol.
They will make a move, and we will catch them.
Everything they do is near flawless.
But if we push them into a corner, they will act like common criminals.
Ugly is what we do, son.
I think you should see this.
Bodhi's gonna finish what Ozaki started, no matter what.
But he needs money to do that.
They can't do a damn thing.
Hugh, how many banks are in the area?
But this is Saturday, none are open.
Except a small branch on top of the mountain.
But no one would be crazy enough to try anything there.
It's on top of a mountain.
Only one road, up or down. A total chokepoint.
Chokepoint is exactly what they want.
It's time to choose whose side you're on.
I don't want you dyin' on my watch, so don't.
That's one hell of a bucket list.
PAPPAS: Why isn't number four crossed off?
I thought he surfed the wave.
He chose to save my life instead.
Thought he said it was gonna be an easy job.
The first six ordeals all travel in one direction, down.
But Seven, "Master of Six Lives," asks you to go against gravity, go up.
And no ropes, no protection, no second chances.
Now, there are just a handful of ascents in the world that match Ozaki's standard for the impossible, but only one that lies outside of the reach of the U.S. government...
It's also the country that Bodhi was born in.
Excuse me, sir. There is a call for you.
We have no diplomatic relationships with Venezuela.
We have no extradition treaty with Venezuela.
We get this sonofabitch when he pops up next.
If he survives this next ordeal, he's got two left, correct?
But the wave like the one off France is incredibly rare.
It could be years until there's a swell that size again.
And the 8th Ordeal, "Act of Ultimate Trust," is a mystery.
No one knows what it means.
I need to get to Bodhi in the 7th Ordeal before he starts to climb.
We can't even get into the country.
I will not let this go, sir.
Do you understand? He's out of reach.
I make mistakes. Now, I know that.
But I promised you I could do this job.
Pap, can we get him in?
Try not to get yourself killed, kid.
GROMMET: Bodhi, I can't see the line.
I do see it, and it's beautiful.
You know I always trusted you, right?
To follow a line I can't even see?
It's not my line. It's yours.
Come on!  You can get it! Go for it!
UTAH: Do you have any idea how many laws you've broken?
No gear, no shoes, no body, nothin'.
"The Act of Ultimate Trust:" Bodhi went over the falls on purpose.
I guess this is a really small world, isn't it?
I just knew if you were alive anywhere on the Earth, there's no way you'd let this go.
"Life of Water." It's the last ordeal you need to complete The Eight.
I'm here to take you in because if you go out there, you're not comin' back, Bodhi!
